metadata.title: CVE-2016-4970 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
handler/ssl/OpenSslEngine.java in Netty 4.0.x before 4.0.37.Final and 4.1.x before 4.1.1.Final allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-4970` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:4.0.37-1
No subscription required

notes.note: seth-arnold> Users can use -Djdk.tls.rejectClientInitiatedRenegotiation=true to disable renegotiation and avoid this issue. Versions affected: Netty 4.0.0.Final - 4.0.36.Final and 4.1.0.Final

criterions.comment: netty package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.0.37-1').
